metadata.title: CVE-2015-1346 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 3.30.33.15, asused in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91, allow attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.4.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
